review_title: Great place to work - I've worked there three times
pros: I started working there in early September and I did my due diligence in talking to numerous people who I already knew that were working there. Almost to a person was told this was the place to work at. They focused on the servant leadership of the current manager Mike and the openness of each and everyone of the management team from Mike up to the CEO. From there I decided that I wanted to work there. Mike has certainly lived up to the Servant leader reputation, he is fair and honest and open. He exudes the open door policy but when something goes wrong and discipline is needed he is fair in his meting the discipline out. The hospital lives the "Just Culture" mantra and compared to my previous work, this is a breath of fresh air. The Hospital has in my opinion overcome it's history of having a bad reputation and care has become very very good. The hospital earned a incredible prestigious honor and was named a five-star rating for overall quality from the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) in the most recent release of its Overall Hospital Quality Star Ratings in July 2022. I consider our Ambulance service to be one of the Top ambulance services in the state, we were featured in the MEMSA monthly magazine for the October issue and our ambulance service picture is featured on www.memsa.org main page The hospital is forward thinking due to a incredible leadership "C-suite" team and to prove this point, the hospital has identified a missing component in the mid missouri area for cancer patients. We are building a Radiation Oncology center on campus that will allow cancer patients who would normally have to drive up to 100 miles one way to get their radiation treatment (which usually lasts 10-20 minutes) and then drive home. Having a radiation oncology option closer to home for these patients is a game changer and could be the difference in having those patients say no to that type of treatment due to the drive. One of the other neat things about GVMH is Craig our CEO gives out at new employee orientation his personal cell phone number to all new employees and urges them to use that number if they ever need to talk to him. Talk about an open door policy. We are a level III stroke center, meaning we can treat strokes with medication up to 4.5 hours from start of symptoms. I could go on and on but these are just some of the reasons why I have returned to work at this organization for a third time since 1990.
cons: Some of my cons are: 1. The hospital sends a lot of patients to other facilities. This ends up with a lot of transfers for the ambulance service. Of course many of these cannot be avoided but some seem to be able to be taken care of in house in my opinion but I am not a physician so I cannot make that determination. 2. There are still some services that this hospital does not have on a 24 hour basis but I know that the administration is actively recruiting for providers to fill those voids. 3. My manager although he is open and communicates openly even he admits that he has a problem with communication and is working on it. I have not seen any issues with communication but it's nice to see that a manager is willing to admit to shortcomings especially when my previous job didn't have this openness. 4. The FTO process could have been more focused. Feedback was given but not as detailed as it could have been. Places I've been to before have had a much more robust FTO process than here. This is an easy fix and easily implemented.

pros: Pro would be that you get promised hours.
cons: Con would be that sometimes you get overworked.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse Med Surg Unit Nurse in Clinton, MO
pros: The management team is fantastic, there is self scheduling and if you need to they work with you to change shifts, they give you the resources you need to give excellent care to our patients. Management keeps employees involved with their own success here and encourages improvement, and even cheers you on. Almost everyone is in a good mood here most of the time. Excellent staff to patient ratios.
cons: I really don't have anything to say in this catagory.

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Clinton, MO
pros: My manager appreciates and respects me. When the going gets tough, the staff work together to accomplish the work at hand. The institution is very involved in community activities and promotes wellness through social events. Continuing education is encouraged.
cons: I would be hard-pressed to come up with any con.

job_title: Clinical Care Coordinator in Clinton, MO
pros: My co-workers and I are care about each other, our co-workers; and our patients. We work together as a team, and provide a great environment to work!
cons: We each have experiences, thoughts, and view points. Yet, WE are open to hear each other and work for the best of care for our patients. This is not really a negative as our patient's benefit in the care we provide.

job_title: ICU Registered Nurse in Clinton, MO
pros: Icu and floor manager is great
cons: Administration and Er is very mean girl atmosphere.

job_title: ER Unit Secretary in Clinton, MO
pros: Directors, Administration, and Charge Nurses are fair and good people to work with and for. Staff truly understands and practices amazing teamwork!
cons: Days when department is short staffed can be hectic and difficult.

pros: Supervisors commitment to making a great work place for employees.
cons: There is nothing I would consider a con to working at Golden Valley.
Pay is low compared to others in area

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant (CMA) in Clinton, MO
pros: Great working environment, understanding towards child care needs.
cons: Pay could be better, but okay for proximity.

review_title: New management not as good as old
Truly one of the best places to work in healthcare
pros: GVMH is far ahead of the curve when it comes to providing the best care to the patient and the best employment to staff.  From the minute you enter the facility you will feel comfortable and valued.  Management genuinely cares about each employee's development and personal goals.  I love working for a company whose vision aligns with my personal beliefs.  We are motivated by our belief that we are changing the world of healthcare for the better.  These reasons make it easy to come to work everyday.  The team environment is healthy and supportive and I am always proud to say that I am an employee of this amazing facility.
cons: I cannot think of any cons to working at GVMH.  Any time I have had an issue or problem or concern it is has quickly been addressed by my supervisor and resolved with the best solution.  I appreciate that management takes the time to listen to each employee with their ideas on how we can continue to improve and continue being successful.

review_title: Good ol' boys reign still alive and well.
pros: The people are great to work with except for management.
cons: The "Good ol' boys" reign. They do not have any women in a management position. ALL strong women that stand up the senior management are fired. The board of directors takes no initiaves to find out the real truth of what is really going on in the hospital. It's a sad state of affairs. They've had such a great staff what really wanted to do a good job but are not allowed to because of senior management.

review_title: A Healthcare Facility where Accountability,  Compassion,  and Excellence is a priority.
job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Clinton, MO
pros: This hospital exceeds its promised Mission,  Vision, and Values.  All employees smile and go above and beyond to serve all of their customers. From admission through discharge,  all patient's are treated with Compassion and Excellence  with the goal assisting and helping patients meet all of their health care goals.
cons: There have been no downsides of working for Golden valley memorial hospital.

review_title: Incredible - Patients are central to the mission.
pros: Patient-centric approach to healthcare.  Staff satisfaction is considered critical to success.  Not perfect but trying to get there.
cons: No real cons... obviously not perfect but interested in working toward it.

review_title: Transitional Care Management following up on patients
job_title: Clinical Care Coordinator in Clinton, MO
pros: 11 years of working with Friendly Coworkers out of 13 yrs
cons: There always has to be one person who isn’t willing to smile and say good morning to acknowledge another person within 5 ft of you.

pros: Friendly atmosphere and less red tape with administration. They are accessible and do their best to make this a great place to work. Great staff!
cons:
Pay scales are a bit lower than average in the area.
Would say PHO accrual rate is a bit lower than my last job
